title: 'Truth will come out': TVK's Vijay on Karur stampede; big message for CM Stalin
content: TVK chief Vijay expressed deep pain over the Karur stampede that killed 41, questioning the FIR against his party leaders and asking if CM Stalin was seeking revenge. He claimed to have requested police for a safe tour location and challenged the Chief Minister, stating he is ready for any action.

title: 'Took orders from US': BJP lashes out after Chidambaram's big 26/11 admission
content: The Bhartiya Janta Party criticized former union home minister P Chidambaram. He recently stated the UPA government did not retaliate after the 26/11 Mumbai attacks. Chidambaram mentioned foreign pressure influenced this decision. The BJP accused the Congress of mishandling the situation. They questioned the UPA's accountability regarding the terror incident. This sparked a political debate.

title: 'Gold rush' for India? Trump's H-1B move falls flat; US may lose high-value jobs
content: Donald Trump's H-1B visa fee increase to $100,000, intended to safeguard US jobs, is reportedly backfiring. US companies are now accelerating the shift of high-value work, including AI and product development, to India's booming Global Capability Centers. This move could turbocharge India's rise as a global innovation hub, despite potential future tax hurdles.

title: US government leaks iPhone secrets: Apple schematics go public; FCC under fire
content: The Federal Communications Commission accidentally published confidential iPhone 16e schematics online, despite Apple's explicit request to keep the 163-page document sealed. This leak, likely due to an incorrect database setting, exposes detailed internal components and could significantly benefit competitors, independent repair shops, and hardware researchers. Although the FCC removed the document, copies remain circulated online.

title: 'Board of Peace': What is Tony Blair's role in Trump's Gaza peace plan?
content: US President Donald Trump unveiled a 20-point Gaza peace plan, proposing a ceasefire, hostage release, and a "New Gaza" governed by a technocratic Palestinian committee. Trump would chair a "Board of Peace" with Tony Blair to oversee redevelopment.

title: 'Pakistan school ke bachhe utha ke le aaye': Kuldeep's coach recalls chats with his ward
content: Kuldeep Yadav's coach, Kapil Dev Pandey, lauded his student's stellar performance in India's Asia Cup 2025 victory over Pakistan. Pandey revealed Kuldeep's disciplined aggression, fueled by past frustration, helped him dismantle Pakistan's "kids" team, as Kuldeep reportedly called them, by focusing on batters' stances and strategic bowling.

title: Nvidia CEO on H-1B visa fees hike: Great start, but $100,000 fees is...
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has backed President Trump's H-1B visa program overhaul, hailing it as a "great start" to address system abuse. However, Huang warned that the new $100,000 application fee is prohibitively expensive, risking the deterrence of foreign talent and driving tech investment away from the US. He emphasized that attracting global talent is crucial for America's future, cautioning the high cost could disadvantage startups and impact international talent flows, while also addressing concerns about Chinese researchers.

title: Raipur shaken by lodge murder: Pregnant teen stabs boyfriend to death, flees
content: A shocking murder has emerged in Raipur, where a 16-year-old girl allegedly fatally stabbed her 20-year-old engineering student boyfriend, Mohammed Saddam, inside a lodge. Police discovered Saddam's body with multiple stab wounds after the girl was seen leaving alone. She later confessed, claiming pregnancy and self-defense after he allegedly threatened her during a heated dispute over marriage.

title: Retired out in IPL, hero in Asia Cup final: How Tilak Varma turned a corner
content: After a painful 'retired out' incident in the 2025 IPL, Tilak Varma received crucial guidance from his childhood coach, Salam Bayash. This mentorship helped him deliver an unbeaten 69 in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan, leading India to victory and fulfilling his determination to win for the team.

title: Accenture layoffs: CEO says ‘we are exiting" employees we can't retrain
content: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands of employees this year, citing their inability to be retrained in AI skills, as it reshapes its workforce for the AI era. The company is simultaneously expanding its AI capabilities and plans to increase headcount, reflecting a broader industry trend of adapting to AI or facing obsolescence.

title: 'Bigger picture was lost': Former NSA Bolton slams Trump's tariffs on India
content: John Bolton sharply criticized Donald Trump's decision to impose tariffs on India for purchasing Russian oil, arguing Trump ignored the strategic picture. Bolton noted Trump sanctioned India but not China, a larger buyer, or Russia itself. This move, which India called "unfortunate," weakens Western efforts while the US continues trade with Russia.

title: GDP growth at 6.5%: US tariffs to weigh down India's economic growth?
content: India's FY26 growth forecast was cut to 6.5% by ADB, down from 7%, primarily due to US tariffs impacting exports. While strong domestic demand and service exports will soften the blow, fiscal and current account deficits are set to widen. Inflation is lowered for FY26 but expected to rise in FY27.

title: Gabrielle Union reveals her biggest fear after Dwyane Wade’s cancer diagnosis
content: Gabrielle Union revealed her biggest fear when Dwyane Wade was diagnosed with kidney cancer, admitting she worried about raising their children alone. His secrecy regarding his health decisions caused distrust, nearly bringing their marriage to rock bottom. Wade underwent surgery in December 2023 to remove 40% of his right kidney.

title: Barron Trump shuts down an entire floor of Trump Tower for date night
content: Barron Trump, 19, recently hosted a romantic meet-up at Trump Tower, reportedly shutting down an entire floor for privacy. Residing at the White House and attending NYU's Washington campus, he is popular among peers despite security challenges that lead him to connect with friends via Xbox chat. His unique lifestyle includes a significant net worth from crypto investments.

title: ‘I Love Muhammad’ row: 38 shops on ‘waqf land’ vacated by Bareilly admin
content: Bareilly authorities sealed 38 shops, predominantly minority-owned, citing encroachment days after a clash between protesters and police. Shop owners allege this action is a reprisal for Friday's unrest, while the district magistrate stated it's part of a crackdown on rioters. The IMC chief, linked to the shops, was arrested earlier.

title: 22,000 tech layoffs: Accenture, Microsoft hit; 5 career moves to make
content: In 2025, over 22,000 tech jobs were cut at major firms including Accenture, Microsoft, Intel, and Salesforce. AI adoption, efficiency drives, and shifting skill demands are reshaping the industry. Workers must adapt by reskilling strategically, focusing on roles that complement automation, and preparing for ongoing volatility. The future rewards adaptability, not tenure, in an AI-driven economy.

title: Karur stampede: Chennai police arrests youtuber Felix Gerald
content: Chennai police arrested YouTuber Felix Gerald for questioning over videos he published about the Karur stampede, which claimed 41 lives. This detention is part of a broader police crackdown on misinformation surrounding the incident, following earlier arrests of three individuals for spreading rumors. Authorities are monitoring online platforms and warn of strict legal action against those circulating false narratives.

title: 'Call to Putin': Russia accused of torturing Ukrainians with electric shock to genitals
content: A forthcoming UN report details Russian forces' brutal torture of Ukrainian prisoners and civilians, including electrocution with a Soviet-era military telephone. The UN special rapporteur describes the widespread abuse, encompassing sexual violence and beatings, as war crimes and crimes against humanity, holding Russia's highest leadership responsible for these systematic tactics.

title: UP man held for murdering wife, mom, father to claim Rs 50 crore insurance
content: A man was arrested in Hapur for allegedly murdering his first wife, father, and mother. He sought Rs 50 crore in insurance claims. His fourth wife alerted police about suspicious deaths. The accused had already received Rs 1.5 crore. Police are investigating a wider multi-state insurance scam. The father had 64 policies worth Rs 50 crore.

title: Techie in shorts assaulted at govt co-working space in Chennai over ‘dress code’
content: Assistant engineer Vijayakumar said they had to bring in some guys to throw the people out as they kept arguing.

title: Gold prices hit new high! US reserves cross $1tn in value; over 90 times fixed value
content: The US Treasury's gold reserves now exceed $1 trillion at market prices, vastly surpassing their official $11 billion valuation. Record gold prices, driven by market volatility, have created this potential $990 billion windfall, which could address half the budget deficit. However, revaluing these reserves is not being seriously considered due to financial system concerns.

title: MP woman dies while dancing with husband at Garba event
content: A 19-year-old woman, Sonam Yadav, tragically died while dancing with her husband at a Garba pandal in Khargone, Madhya Pradesh. She suddenly fainted and was declared dead at the hospital. The incident, captured on a viral video, occurred without police being formally informed, and her last rites were performed without a post-mortem.

title: Heavy rains lash Delhi: IMD issues 'orange alert', IndiGo warns of flight delays
content: Heavy rain brought much-needed relief to Delhi-NCR from oppressive heat, prompting the IMD to issue an 'orange' alert for continued moderate rainfall, thunderstorms, and gusty winds. The downpour disrupted routine movement, leading IndiGo to advise travellers of potential flight delays.

title: More H-1B changes? 'Inexpensive' techies under lens; lottery system facing axe
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced significant H-1B visa changes, including a $100,000 fee effective February 2026. He criticized the current system for "inexpensive" tech consultants, expecting thoughtful reforms. This steep fee raises concerns for Indian professionals and US businesses, with India studying its implications.

title: NASA warns house sized asteroid 2025 SA3 set to zoom past Earth at 18000 mph
content: Asteroid 2025 SA3, a 54-foot space rock, will safely pass Earth on September 30, 2025, at a distance of 1.67 million miles. This close approach, while posing no threat, underscores the critical importance of continuous monitoring of near-Earth objects by international agencies like NASA and ISRO for planetary defense and scientific research.

title: 'You left a mark on me': Pant's hilarious tribute to retiring Woakes
content: Indian wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant shared a light-hearted retirement message for England all-rounder Chris Woakes, who inadvertently caused Pant's fractured foot. Pant, currently sidelined from upcoming series, wished Woakes well after his distinguished 15-year international career. Woakes, retiring from England duty, will continue playing county cricket, while Pant recovers, highlighting a unique cricketing bond between the two players.

title: Demis Hassabis to grads: 4 ways to get ahead; thrive in the AI age
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis outlines four ways graduates can thrive in the age of artificial intelligence: mastering AGI tools, building a strong STEM foundation, developing prompt engineering and fine-tuning skills, and adopting a lifelong learning mindset. His advice stresses that future leaders will be those who are “native” with AI systems and able to shape their evolution.

title: IPL: Is RCB up for sale? Lalit Modi weighs in on franchise's future
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru, after securing their maiden IPL title in 2025 and subsequently facing tragedy, is reportedly up for sale. Former IPL commissioner Lalit Modi confirmed that current owners Diageo Plc intend to sell the franchise. This move is anticipated to attract global investors, setting a new record valuation and reshaping the IPL's financial landscape.

title: Delhi 'godman' exposed: 'Torture room' unearthed at Vasant Kunj institute
content: Chaitanyananda Saraswati, accused of molesting 17 women, was taken by police to his institute for questioning about an alleged "torture room" and CCTV locations. His seized phone showed live campus surveillance access, even while he was on the run. Police also arrested an associate for threatening a victim's father.

title: Who is Jason Taylor's wife? Meet the woman behind his embarrassing ‘Coldplay Moment’
content: Former Dolphins star Jason Taylor had a viral 'Coldplay Moment' during Monday Night Football when cameras caught his wife Monica moving off his lap, sparking widespread laughter. This relatable interaction highlighted the human side of the NFL Hall of Famer, also showcasing Monica's impressive career as an entrepreneur and philanthropist.

title: Mid-air scare: Bangkok-bound AirAsia flight returns to Lucknow after hydraulic failure
content: AirAsia flight FD 147, en route to Bangkok from Lucknow, encountered a hydraulic failure shortly after takeoff on Monday night. Pilots safely returned the aircraft, carrying 138 people, to Lucknow Airport after 21 minutes airborne. The flight was cancelled, and the grounded plane is now under inspection.

title: 'Ashamed' - WC-winning ex-India player slams politics, provocative gestures
content: Former India wicketkeeper Syed Kirmani expressed profound disappointment over modern cricket's declining sportsmanship, feeling "ashamed" by the Asia Cup 2025's political controversies. He criticized provocative gestures and India's refusal to accept the trophy from Pakistan's ACC chief, calling the episode "disgusting." Kirmani lamented the lost camaraderie between India and Pakistan, stressing that politics must not enter sports.

title: New H-1B visa allocation: Is new weighted selection bad news for Indian IT?
content: The Trump administration's proposed H-1B weighted visa system, prioritizing higher-paid applicants, might not be detrimental for Indian IT. Experts suggest it could be less harmful, potentially benefiting firms recruiting experienced professionals in Wage Levels II and III.

title: Mumbai-Delhi IndiGo flight with 200 onboard receives bomb threat
content: An IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Delhi, carrying around 200 people, received a bomb threat on Tuesday morning. Flight 6E 762 landed safely at Delhi airport around 7:53 am after a full emergency was declared. Security agencies later assessed the threat as non-specific, according to sources. An official statement from IndiGo regarding the incident is currently awaited.

title: US peace plan for Gaza: Trump praises Pak; calls Shehbaz, Asim 'incredible'
content: US President Donald Trump praised Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Army Chief Asim Munir. They supported his Gaza peace plan. Trump called them incredible. This commendation followed their Oval Office meeting. US-Pakistan ties improved since Trump's return. Washington signed a deal for critical minerals. A US firm invested in Pakistani minerals. Trump's plan aims to end the Gaza conflict.

title: Asia Cup heroes return home: Gambhir welcomed in Ahmedabad, Surya in Mumbai – Watch
content: India's cricketing heroes returned to rapturous fan celebrations after their unbeaten T20 Asia Cup 2025 triumph, including multiple victories over archrivals Pakistan. Coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Suryakumar Yadav were greeted by ecstatic supporters. The victorious squad now shifts focus to a two-match Test series against West Indies, starting October 2, aiming to extend their winning streak.

title: TCS layoff rumours: 6 coping tricks to survive amid massive job cuts
content: A false rumour of 80,000 TCS layoffs created widespread panic, though only 12,000 were impacted. This incident highlights a global tech trend of workforce reductions driven by AI and restructuring, causing significant employee anxiety. Both employees and companies must adopt strategies like clear communication and reskilling to navigate this uncertain landscape.

title: 'PCB wants obedient, lallu-kattu kids': Akhtar slams Pakistan cricket
content: Legendary fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar delivered a scathing post-mortem of Pakistan’s Asia Cup 2025 final loss to India, criticising the PCB, captain Salman Agha, and coach Mike Hesson. He attributed the defeat to systemic flaws, including a lack of aggression, poor strategic choices, and the board's preference for "obedient kids" over strong personalities, advocating for grassroots reforms.

title: Pothole pangs: Bengaluru college student run over by truck
content: A 20-year-old student, Dhanushree, tragically died in Bengaluru after being run over by a speeding truck near Budigere Cross. While police investigate if potholes contributed, residents blame poor road conditions and lack of streetlights. The truck driver fled, and a case for negligence has been registered. This incident reignites concerns over city road safety and infrastructure.

title: Centre invokes Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty with Singapore over singer Zubeen Garg’s death: Assam CM Himanta Sarma
content: The Assam Government has constituted a 10-member Special Investigation Team (SIT), led by Special DGP M.P. Gupta, to investigate the singer's death in Singapore due to drowning on September 19

title: Will resign rather than ally with BJP for statehood restoration: Omar Abdullah
content: Omar Abdullah said had he included the BJP in the government, the statehood might have been restored sooner

title: TVK leader Aadhav Arjuna faces flak for deleted X post calling for Nepal-like ‘uprising’ in T.N.
content: The post attracted widespread criticism from political parties. DMK deputy general secretaries Kanimozhi and A. Raja, and MDMK general secretary Vaiko condemned his remarks

title: Delhi airport to introduce E-Arrival Card facility for foreign travellers from October 1
content: Similar facilities are available at airports in Thailand, Indonesia, Singapore, South Korea, and Malaysia

title: Bombay High Court, Marriage to minor no shield from rape charges under POCSO Act
content: Factual consent in a relationship between or with minors is immaterial under the provisions of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences, the court said

title: Kerala Police launch training to tackle rising child sexual abuse material cases
content: Victim identification taskforce programme at Kerala Police Academy in Thrissur equips officers with advanced skills and emotional support to strengthen child safety efforts

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates Chennai’s longest flyover, named after late MLA J. Anbazhagan, in T. Nagar
content: The 2-km flyover is expected to ease traffic congestion in T. Nagar and reduce travel time for motorists from areas such as Guindy, Saidapet, and Nungambakkam

title: J&K High Court to consider setting up Special Bench to hear plea challenging forfeiture order against 25 books
content: The petition was filed by former Air Vice Marshal Kapil Kak; Dr. Sumantra Bose, whose two books have been forfeited; author Dr. Radha Kumar; and former Chief Information Commissioner Wajahat Habibullah

title: In pictures | Durga Puja pandals lead the way to a festive Navaratri
content: Artists rethink traditional Durga Puja art and create grand decorations all over India. Here are some images from the country showing the grandeur.

title: Dip in murders; cybercrimes, crimes against Scheduled Tribe spiked in 2023: NCRB report
content: NCRB data for 2023 shows decrease in murder cases, rise in crimes against Scheduled Tribes, and surge in cybercrimes

title: FCV tobacco prices surge on export boom, farmers reap record gains
content: In the last five years, farmers’ average earnings have more than doubled, thanks to strong global demand and a disciplined marketing system, Tobacco Board of India Chairperson Yashwanth Kumar Chidipothu said

title: Jointness is an operational necessity, not a choice, says Rajnath Singh at IAF Seminar
content: Referring to Operation Sindoor, Rajnath Singh said the tri-services synergy during the exercise created a unified, real-time operational picture that empowered commanders with timely decisions, enhanced situational awareness and reduced the risk of fratricide

title: Rahul Gandhi says PM Modi 'betrayed' people of Ladakh, demands judicial probe into police firing fatalities
content: Rahul Gandhi demands judicial probe into Ladakh killings, accuses PM Modi of betrayal, sparking outrage and calls for justice

title: Karnataka floods: CM undertakes aerial inspection of crop damage in Kalaburagi district
content: The first round of the survey focused on the severely affected villages in Kalaburagi district. Later, the CM is expected to undertake an aerial inspection of Bidar district to assess crop loss and damage

title: Watch: Bihar deputy CM Samrat Choudhary interview: ‘This election is ‘Modiwaad’ and ‘Nitshwaad’
content: In an exclusive interview to The Hindu, the former party State president, who is also the leader of the BJP Legislature Party, said that seat sharing arrangements would be done soon. He asserted that Nitish Kumar will remain the CM if NDA is voted to power.

title: Andhra government approves ticket price hike for Kantara Chapter-1
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu and Deputy Chief Minister K. Pawan Kalyan content that art is meant to unite people, not divide them by language or regional barriers.

title: Two Kerala Forest officers suspended after Vigilance probe uncovers nexus with contractors
content: VACB’s Statewide raids undertaken as part of Operation Vanaraksha across 71 forest range offices exposed a pattern of irregularities and nexus between a section of forest officials and contractors

title: KDA backs Leh Apex body’s stand, says no talks with Centre till detainees freed
content: “We are constantly in touch with Apex Body Leh ... We will not participate in the talks with the Centre till Sonam Wangchuk is released, arrests are stopped, those arrested are released, and a judicial probe is ordered,” Mr. Karbalai said

title: BJP’s Arjun Singh alleges shots fired, crude bombs hurled outside his house in West Bengal’s North 24 Parganas
content: TMC’s Jagaddal MLA Somenath Shyam Ichini refuted the allegations, claiming that BJP’s Arjun Singh himself was responsible for violence in the area

title: Vaiko blames TVK for Karur stampede, accuses party of spreading rumours to mislead public
content: Speaking to reporters in Chennai, Mr. Vaiko said the organisers failed to plan the rally properly, which led the situation to spiral out of control

title: Fake bomb threat sparks panic at Kannur railway station; caller with mental illness taken into custody
content: The call, received on the emergency number 112 around 11 p.m., claimed that a bomb had been planted at the station. Soon, the railway police, RPF, bomb squad and dog squad conducted a thorough search of the station and surrounding areas but found nothing

title: Union Minister Suresh Gopi sparks row with remark that ‘those elected by corpses are cheating Kerala’
content: Participating in a neighbourhood town hall meeting in Thrissur, Suresh Gopi says ‘cadavers dead for 25 years’ have voted in elections in Kerala

title: Andhra Pradesh: Heavy flood flow in Krishna and Godavari Rivers, alerts issued
content: Officials have urged residents of low-lying and flood-prone areas along both rivers to remain vigilant and take precautionary measures

title: Tilak Varma: Hyderabad’s latest cricket sensation
content: He caught the eye of coach Salim Bayash at the age of 11, who taught him the ropes at the Legala Cricket Academy in Lingampally

title: Hockey legend Mohammed Shahid's house demolished in Varanasi, family protests
content: The family of the Padma Shri awardee said that no compensation was received for the road-widening drive; authorities claim otherwise

title: Malabar leg of Kerala’s Champions Boat League to kick off in Dharmadam on October 2
content: Inaugural race to see 15 churuli (spiral) boats competing over a 1-km course from Mamakunnu bridge to Muzhappilangad Kadavu

title: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman to lead Indian delegation to P20 Summit in South Africa
content: During the summit, which will be held from October 1 to 3, Mr. Harivansh will participate in key deliberations that underscore India’s commitment to global cooperation and sustainable development

title: Karur stampede: First accused Mathiyazhagan, another TVK functionary sent to 15-day judicial custody
content: M.C. Pounraj had allegedly sheltered accused number one and Karur West district secretary V.P. Mathiyazhagan

title: ‘Death threat’ to Rahul Gandhi: Kerala Opposition boycotts Assembly, slams LDF govt’s ‘dismissive’ stance
content: UDF disrupts House proceedings after Speaker declines Opposition’s notice for adjournment debate about government’s ‘failure to prosecute’ a BJP spokesperson who aired ‘death threats’ against Rahul Gandhi on live television

title: IndiGo's Mumbai-Delhi flight gets bomb threat
content: The flight 6E 762 had around 200 people on board and the security agencies found the threat to be non-specific, the source told PTI

title: Chaitanyananda Saraswati confronted with female aides; pictures, messages with women found on his phone
content: Chaitanyananda Saraswati’s phones also had multiple photographs of him with air hostesses and screenshots of display pictures of women, police said

title: Pre-partition Bengal, Indian freedom movement emerge as popular themes in Kolkata’s Durga Pujas
content: This trend assumes significance with the resurgence of the Bengal’s pre-partition history and its freedom fighters in public consciousness, through ‘The Bengal Files’ controversy and with Trinamool’s ‘Bengali pride’ campaign

title: Gandhi statue in London vandalised, Indian mission strongly condemns ‘violent act’
content: The Indian mission said it has reported the desecration to the local authorities, even as its officials are at the site to coordinate the restoration of the monument to its original state

title: 3 militants arrested in Manipur
content: An active member of the proscribed Peoples' Liberation Army (PLA) was arrested near his house in Kadangband in Imphal West district on September 29, they said.

title: 71st Wildlife Week to be celebrated in Karnataka from October 2–8
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will inaugurate the week-long celebrations on October 2 by flagging off a walkathon from Vidhana Soudha to Lalbagh in Bengaluru

title: This year, Kolkata’s pandals put the spotlight on ‘Bengali pride’
content: Amid the ongoing controversy around Bengali language, identity, and crisis of migrant labourers Durga Pujas bring spotlight to the issue

title: Tamil Nadu: Candidates up to 40 years of age could now get admitted into UG courses in arts and science colleges
content: In case of candidates who are persons with disabilities, the upper age limit could further be relaxed by five years

title: Four-hour relaxation in curfew announced in Leh; forces deployed in strength
content: Additional District Magistrate in Leh, Ghulam Mohammed, ordered opening of all groceries, essential services, hardware and vegetable shops during the relaxation period

title: Former MP Prajwal Revanna challenges conviction in rape case in Karnataka High Court
content: Revanna, who was arrested in May last year after returning from Germany, is contesting the verdict on several grounds, including what he claims are contradictions in the survivor's testimony and inconsistencies in the evidence produced by the prosecution

title: Self-styled preacher Virender Deo Dixit wanted in rape cases has died, CBI tells court
content: Virender Deo Dixit, against whom an Interpol Blue Notice was issued in 2018, was allegedly on the run after the CBI registered cases against him on the orders of the Delhi High Court in 2017

title: YouTuber Felix Gerald arrested for video attributing motives to Karur stampede
content: The police said cases were registered against 25 social media account holders who posted rumours about the stampede and spread misinformation about the State government and police

title: Vijay Kumar Malhotra, veteran BJP leader, passes away at 94
content: Malhotra has been a five-time MP and two-time MLA from Delhi and was a prominent face of the party in the capital

title: Flood threat continues in Andhra Pradesh as Krishna, Godavari remain swollen
content: Two NDRF and three SDRF teams have been deployed in vulnerable areas; APSDMA Managing Director warns people against crossing overflowing streams, canals, or inundated roads

title: PM Modi welcomes Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan
content: The peace proposal for Gaza aims to end the war between Israel and Hamas militants and requires the return of all hostages, living and dead, within 72 hours of a ceasefire

title: Why was X’s ‘censorship’ challenge against Centre’s Sahyog portal rejected?
content: Experts told The Hindu that the ruling risks enabling sweeping censorship of information essential for ensuring political accountability

title: ’Union govt has imposed undeclared President’s rule in Punjab,’ says CM Mann
content: Mr. Mann was speaking on the discussion surrounding the State’s recent floods and rehabilitation during the special session of the Punjab State Assembly.

title: Tharoor flags concerns over Air India Express plans to curtail Kerala flights
content: Any curtailment of services at this stage will inevitably cause severe hardship to migrant workers, students, tourists and families, while also hampering trade and tourism, Shashi Tharoor says

title: UPSC finalises panel of three officers fit for appointment as T.N. DGP
content: Once the panel is received, the State would have to immediately appoint one of the officers as a regular DGP/HoPF with a minimum tenure of two years in compliance with the Supreme Court order.

title: Sociology student from Mumbai wins Srinivas Rayaprol Poetry Prize 2025
content: The prize, including a citation and cash award of ₹15,000, will be presented on October 25, marking the birth centenary of Srinivas Rayaprol.

title: ‘Fulfil poll promise on granting affiliation to Haryana schools’
content: The BJP had in its 2014 Assembly election manifesto promised that after forming the government, unrecognised schools would be granted one-time permanent affiliation by easing the norms

title: CSL expands CSR footprint into community-driven agriculture projects
content: CSL to back three major agriculture projects related to precision farming, including revival of a sprawling paddy field, installation of weather monitoring systems, and setting up a climate-resilient paddy processing unit

title: HC seeks to stop police from leaking alleged confession statements of accused to media
content: Even if in certain circumstances portions of such statements are made public, the police should clarify that they are not admissible as evidence against the accused in a criminal trial, said a Division Bench of Justice A.K. Jayasankaran Nambiar and Justice Jobin Sebastian

title: The RSS is a ‘ten-headed Ravana that represents regressive tendencies’: Congress leader
content: The ten faces stand for regressive tendencies like anti-constitutional behaviour, anti-religious attitudes, and anti-democratic actions. The destruction of these will be the real Vijayadashami

title: Karur stampede: TVK district secretary and first accused Mathiyazhagan picked up for police inquiry
content: TVK’s Karur West district secretary V.P. Mathiyazhagan is named as accused number one in the FIR registered by the Karur Town police.

title: Watch: PM Modi urges citizens to back Indian products: “Say with pride – this is Swadeshi!”
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the new Delhi BJP office on September 29 during Navratri celebrations. In his address, he praised the NDA’s governance model, highlighting improvements in security, anti-corruption, and public savings. He cited increased tax exemptions and GST reforms that benefit common citizens. PM Modi also called on BJP workers to promote Swadeshi products with pride, encouraging every shop to display a bold sign reading, “Say with pride, this is Swadeshi.”

title: Uttar Pradesh on unstoppable path under CM Adityanath’s leadership, says Union Minister Goyal
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal praises Uttar Pradesh’s growth under Yogi Adityanath, highlighting safe business environment and investor-friendly policies

title: European envoys raise ‘Russia question’ amid deepening India-EU ties
content: EU Ambassador Herve Delphin says India buying Russian oil and its participation in Zapad military exercise worry Europe; he says it has to ‘square’ Russia partnership with desire to deepen ties with Europe

title: Karur stampede: Palaniswami terms probe panel ‘eyewash’, calls for CBI investigation
content: Contending that the people will not trust the government investigation, the former Chief Minister says, “For the people to know what really happened and to ensure justice, an investigation by the CBI should be ordered.”

title: Ahead of bypoll, over 4,000 voters added in Ghatshila Assembly constituency under Special Summary Revision in Jharkhand
content: Number of male voters in the draft publication was 1,23,314 and female voters’ number was 1,28,050; this has now increased to 1,24,899 and 1,30,921 respectively, in the final publication

title: Last rites of two more protesters held in Leh amid restrictions, curfew continues
content: Educational institutes remain closed, mobile Internet services are suspended; several pockets of Leh town, especially where the main government offices are located, continue to be barricaded with concertina wires

title: Karur stampede: Death toll climbs to 41, probe panel continues inquiry
content: Of the 110 people injured, 51 have been discharged, while 60 remain hospitalised, says Collector M. Thangavel.  The Karur Town police book 10 persons for allegedly assaulting a private ambulance driver

title: Paper leak protest called off after Dhami promises CBI probe
content: Vexed with the recent paper leak in the Uttarakhand Subordinate Services Selection Commission (UKSSSC) graduate-level examination held on September 21, students across the State launched massive protests forcing the government to form an SIT under the chairmanship of a retired High Court judge to investigate the leak. The students, however, remained adamant for a CBI probe

title: Portal glitches and ‘missing records’ slow down registration of Waqf
content: The registration of Waqf properties is moving at a sluggish pace owing to website glitches and record challenges

title: Media should give Palestinians the chance to tell our story: Palestine Ambassador
content: Palestine solidarity meet held on the opening day of International Media Festival of Kerala organised by Kerala Media Academy

title: Rajnath Singh to Celebrate Vijayadashami with Soldiers in Bhuj
content: He will also travel to the forward post at Harami Nala near the India-Pakistan border to interact with the Army and BSF personnel.

title: Tibetan refugee injured during Ladakh protests, recovering in AIIMS ICU
content: A 21-year-old student of nursing in Bengaluru was airlifted from Leh on September 24 and admitted at the ICU in Jai Prakash Narayan Trauma Centre of AIIMS, New Delhi

title: Tyreek Hill injury FAQ: Recovery timetable, his NFL future and how Dolphins will adapt
content: What is the Dolphins WR's outlook for a dislocated knee, the on-field impact of his absence and his future in Miami.

title: Sources: Dolphins' Hill tore ACL, other ligaments
content: Dolphins WR Tyreek Hill dislocated his knee during Monday night's game, according to coach Mike McDaniel. Sources told Adam Schefter on Tuesday that he also tore multiple ligaments in his knee.

title: Glenn blasts 'disappointing' Jets after sloppy loss
content: After watching 60 minutes of error-strewn football, New York Jets coach Aaron Glenn ripped into his winless team with a locker room rant that was heard in the adjacent media room.

title: Bochy, winningest active manager, out in Texas
content: Bruce Bochy, who guided the Rangers to their only World Series championship, will not return as manager in 2026, the team announced Monday.

title: Chase on loss: Didn't look like Bengals 'wanted it'
content: Cincinnati star Ja'Marr Chase, an All-Pro receiver who finished with five catches for only 23 yards Monday in the Bengals' loss to the Denver Broncos, told reporters that "at the end of the day, we gotta want it. Today, it didn't look like we wanted it."

title: LeBron: Contract status 'doesn't bother me at all'
content: Despite being a 21-time All-Star coming off an All-NBA second team selection and playing with no long-term financial commitment from the Lakers, LeBron James said his contract situation will not affect his performance this season.

title: Kawhi: Allegations of no-show deal not accurate
content: Kawhi Leonard said that he doesn't "think it's accurate" that he performed no services for Aspiration, the now-bankrupt green banking company and Clippers team sponsor with which he signed a lucrative endorsement contract.

title: Sirianni: Brown's desire is to remain with Eagles
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni, asked about A.J. Brown's cryptic tweet following Sunday's game, said he believes Brown wants to remain in Philadelphia.

title: Bears coach regrets how TV interview received
content: Bears coach Ben Johnson expressed regret Monday over how his halftime interview during his team's Week 4 win against the Raiders was received.

title: The only MLB playoff preview you need: World Series odds, likely MVPs and how far all 12 teams will go
content: Have Fall Classic or bust hopes for the postseason? Here's why your squad could be playing deep into October ... or get sent home early.

content: Since a runner-up finish a year ago, the Lynx focused on winning it all in 2025. Instead, they're out in the semis.

title: Caitlin Clark fuels women's memorabilia market growth
content: Sports collectibles industry experts say interest in Caitlin Clark cards is leading to growth in the women's memorabilia market overall, particularly for the WNBA.

content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

content: Two years ago in Rome, McIlroy predicted a win at Bethpage. Over three days, gutsy team play made it happen.

content: From 10.5 games back on September 1 to division champions, the Guardians defied the odds to overtake the Tigers.

content: Through five weeks, we've seen first-year players make huge contributions. These 11 players are standing out.

content: In Hurley's "Never Stop: Life, Leadership, and What It Takes To Be Great," he writes that he reached out to Auriemma after UConn's 0-3 trip to the Maui Invitational last November.

content: The offseason carousel starts with openings in San Francisco, Minnesota and Texas. Here's who is out -- and who could be in line to replace them.

content: The Mets nearly won a pennant last year -- and then added Juan Soto. And yet a season of promise turned into an all-time collapse.

content: Son Heung-Min and Denis Bouanga are dragging LAFC up the Western Conference table as well as the order in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

content: Barcelona have set their sights on signing Atlético Madrid striker Julián Álvarez next summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Probe Agency Seizes Over Rs 2 Crore Cash In Raids Against Goa Casino
content: The Enforcement Directorate said it has seized Rs 2.25 crore in cash apart from foreign currency worth Rs 8.5 lakh during multi-state searches against a Goa-based casino and its linked entities.

title: Heavy Rain, Thunderstorm In Delhi And Noida, Airlines Issue Advisory
content: Heavy and sudden rainfall has brought Delhi to a standstill, leaving some areas waterlogged and disrupting traffic on Tuesday.

title: Why Is It Raining This Heavily In Delhi Today? Weather Scientist Explains
content: As Tuesday's sudden rains brought relief from heat in Delhi and surrounding areas, a senior scientist at the IMD said it is not because of the monsoon.

title: Delhi Airport To Introduce E-Arrival Card For Foreign Travellers From October 1
content: E-Arrival Card facility will be available for foreign travellers at the Delhi airport from October 1, a system that will allow international passengers to fill out their arrival information online replacing the manual paper-based cards.

title: Rights Body Seeks Report In Alleged Conversion Case In Madhya Pradesh
content: The complaint claims that 556 Hindu children are being targeted for conversion by being enrolled in 27 unauthorised madrasas operating in Morena and adjoining districts.

title: Indian Man, 54, Extradited To US In 20-Year-Old Car Crash Case
content: India has resumed extraditions to the US after a 17-year hiatus, sending over an Indian citizen wanted in the US on criminal charges, according to officials.

title: Satya Nadella Welcomes Grok 4 To Azure AI Foundry, Elon Musk Responds
content: Microsoft has added Grok 4, the latest language model from Elon Musk's AI startup xAI, to its Azure AI Foundry platform.

title: 'I'll Leak Private Videos': Man Threatens Bengaluru Woman, Extorts Rs 17 Lakh
content: A man assaulted a 32-year-old woman, threatened to leak her private videos online, and extorted over Rs 17 lakh in Bengaluru.

title: 16-Year-Old Bajrang Dal Worker Shot Dead Over Instagram Post In UP's Moradabad
content: A 16-year-old Bajrang Dal worker was allegedly shot dead over a social media post in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, police said on Tuesday.

title: Video Shows Moment Powerful Explosion Hit Pakistan's Quetta, 13 Dead
content: At least ten people were killed and 32 others were injured after a powerful explosion hit Quetta in Pakistan's Balochistan province.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why India Must Think Twice Before Buying The Russian Su-57
content: India faces genuine gaps in fighter strength. But the answer cannot be to mortgage the future of its airpower for a platform already proven inadequate.

title: 103 Illegal Birth Certificates Issued In Mumbai: BJP Leader's Big Charge
content: Over a hundred birth certificates were issued to ineligible persons by the Mumbai civic body, senior BJP leader Kirit Somaiya has claimed in a fresh complaint in connection with the alleged large-scale birth certificate scam.

title: Udaipur's Goddess Baleshwari Mata Adorned With Over Rs 51 Lakh In Cash
content: The Baleshwar Yuva Mandal decorated the deity and the temple with currency notes worth Rs 51,51,551, using denominations of Rs 50, Rs 100, Rs 200, and Rs 500.

title: PM's Adviser Criticises Long Vacations In Higher Courts, Top Lawyer Hits Back
content: The criticism of the judiciary by a key member of the Economic Advisery Council to the Prime Minister has triggered a controversy yet again.

title: India's Trade Pact With 4 European Nations From Oct 1, $100 Billion Investment In 15 Years
content: The free trade agreement between India and the four-nation European bloc EFTA will come into force from October 1 under which New Delhi has received an investment commitment of $100 billion in 15 years.

title: Security Threat On Delhi-Bound Indigo Flight, Cleared For Ops After Check
content: A security threat was noticed in a Delhi-bound IndiGo flight from Mumbai on Tuesday, an IndiGo spokesperson said. The aircraft was cleared for flight after necessary security checks.
